title: Cotton Stole

  title_text: Cotton Stole

  creation_place_original_location: Rajasthan (India)

  styles_periods_indexing_terms: Islamic Indian

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: rectangular

  materials_name: silver (metal) cotton (textile) ink

  techniques_name: weaving sewing (needleworking technique) calligraphy (process) block printing (relief printing process)

  object_colour: multicoloured

  physical_appearance: This cotton stole is predominantly dark green in colour. There is a silver-coloured border along the perimeter of the rectangular stole. Within the border
 there are medallion-shaped patterns running vertically from the top to the bottom of the stole. And within each medallion
 there is a calligraphic writing in script language.

  subject_terms_1: textiles (visual works) Islam nasta?liq  running ornament medallions (ornament areas)

  subject_terms_2: God (Islam) Textiles Stoles (Clothing) Motifs Calligraphy
 Persian Shawls

  subject_terms_3: Islam

  sgcool_label_text: This cotton stole from the Rajasthan region is embellished with block-printing done in silver. The surface of the stole has a repeated medallion
 within which appears the word “Allah” in Nastaliq calligraphy. The narrow border shows a flower vine pattern.
